data.name: 3D Sudoku Builder (a.k.a. multisize skyscraper puzzle)
data.description:
In this kata you have to resolve a sudoku puzzle given the views of each of its four sides. As usual, a sudoku puzzle is a square matrix of NxN (N from 0 to 7) where its values are from 1..N and in each row and column there is no repetition of any number. Suppose further that each number represents the height of a block and that the number of blocks seen from each side (top, down, left, and right) is given. Logically, the taller blocks hide the smaller ones. See image and example. Your job is to find a Sudoku puzzle that fits the view. This is provided with an array in which the order of the rows are: * row 0: up * row 1: down * row 2: left * row 3: right ❒ Yellow is a 4 hight block
❒ Red is a 3 hight block
❒ Green is a 2 hight block
❒ Blue is a 1 hight block You have to implement the function `sudoku_builder`. This function receives a sodoku view and returns a compatible sudoku with this view. If there is no a sudoku compatible with the view, the funtion must raise an exception. ```python # And the view will be sudoku_view = [ [1, 2, 3, 2], # from up [3, 2, 1, 2], # from down [1, 2, 2, 2], # from left [4, 1, 3, 2] # from right ] sudoku_builder(sudoku_view) sudoku_compatible = [ [4, 3, 2, 1], [3, 2, 1, 4], [1, 4, 3, 2], [2, 1, 4, 3] ]
